txt.en: Follow Edhelben as he directs you to the courtyard of Edhelion.\n\nYou master Talagan Silvertongue has told you that he would like you to make your way to the courtyard of Edhelion and help defend it from further attack.
Fight your way to the courtyard of Edhelion.
<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: The files you need to continue your adventures in Middle-earth should finish downloading shortly. Thank you for your patience!</rgb>

'Alas, [placeholder]...you have lost your beloved master. You may blame me for his death -- I could have saved him, but he bade me go to you instead. Talagan was brave to spare your young life.

'Edhelion is ruined now...Talagan was not the only Elf to die today. Skorgrím will trouble us no more, and the relics are safely buried, but it was such a needless battle!

'Edhelion will fade....'

'You cannot tarry here any longer, [placeholder]. Skorgrím's forces are upon us, and I fear they make straight for this library!\n\n'He seeks the relics of Edhelion, though I do not know what a dwarf could want with them. These relics were once coveted by a Gaunt-lord of old. I think the fool believes he can become immortal if he acquires them.'
'Prepare yourself, I am opening the gate now...'

'Good -- you are better armed. Your master Talagan wishes to see you before you venture out into the fray. But do hurry! This place is not safe for you.'

<rgb=#00FF00>ACCESSING YOUR INVENTORY: Press 'i' to open your inventory to see the weapon or left-click on the bag icons on the bottom of your screen.</rgb>

<rgb=#00FF00>EQUIPPING YOUR WEAPON: Right-click on the weapon in your inventory to equip it. This will replace the flimsy weapon you currently have equipped.</rgb>

<rgb=#FF0000>ADVICE: You should equip your best weapon before attempting to engage in combat.</rgb>

'There is no time to waste, [placeholder]. Go outside with Talagan and see what can be done to stop Skorgrím from advancing. The Dourhands cannot be allowed to take the Gaunt-lord's relics; I have vowed to keep them safe.\n\n'I will hide the relics, then I will join Talagan in protecting the library. Be safe, young [placeholder].'
'Go, [placeholder]! This is where the storm will converge. Edhelben is down below -- he will let you through the gate to protect what is left of this refuge.'
'I fear for Edhelion. How much more can we withstand? And I hear that Skorgrím has not even shown himself yet...which means the worst is yet to come.'

'[placeholder], my dear student! I wish I could let you stay safe within these walls, but Elrond tells me that Skorgrím makes straight for this library.\n\n'You must survive the battle outside, I am afraid. I worry for you! Duel with me one last time, my friend, and show me that you are ready. It will ease my heart!'
'Go, [placeholder], and promise me you will return in one piece! Edhelben shall open the gate for you.'
'Should have never let Skorgrím talk us into recruiting goblins!'
Now that you have reached the courtyard of Edhelion, follow Dorongúr Whitethorn into it.

Follow Elrond and Dorongúr Whitethorn to the entrance to the halls of Edhelion.\n\nSoon after you entered the courtyard of Edhelion, the Dourhands broke down the gate. Skorgrím and a party of dwarves ran towards the entrance to Edhelion's halls.
You beloved master Talagan has sacrificed himself to ensure that the relics of Edhelion did not fall into the hands of Skorgrím.\n\nYou should now speak with Elrond about all that has transpired
Speak with Elrond and tell him what you know about Edhelion's relics.
Speak with Elrond and tell him what you know about Edhelion's relics.\n\nTalagan has sacrificed himself to ensure that the relics of Edhelion did not fall into the hands of Skorgrím.
Speak with Elrond and tell him what you know about Edhelion's relics.\n\nTalagan has sacrificed himself to ensure that the relics of Edhelion did not fall into the hands of Skorgrím.
Approach Elrond <rgb=#00FF00>(Move forwards by pressing W)</rgb>
Talk to Elrond <rgb=#00FF00>(Right-click on Elrond to interact)</rgb>
Open the satchel <rgb=#00FF00>(Right-click the satchel to collect what is inside)</rgb>
Follow Elrond to Talagan, your master
Talk to your master, Talagan Silvertongue
'All we can do now is wait and hope that Elrond's forces come soon.'
'Come on, you beast, put your back into it!'
'Come, [placeholder]. The final battle is at hand!'
'Prepare yourself...the gate will not hold long!'
'Look sharp, boys, that gate won't hold long!'
'On hearing the horn-call of Elrond, I thought the battle was over, yet you have brought dire news, that the worst may be yet to come! Let us just hope Elrond comes in time.'
Elrond Halfelven needs to speak with you
There is a weapon in the satchel. You should now loot and equip it before attempting battle
<rgb=#ff0000>Talagan has bested you. You should try again</rgb>
'This is a sad day. I wish I returned but a few moments earlier.'
'Talagan wished for you to be safe, [placeholder]. And the relics are now buried with him.'
'Here, young Elf! Arm yourself; there is little time.'
'Alas that it is not over yet. This way!'
'Ah, it is Talagan's young charge! I will open the gate for you, [placeholder]!'
'We have lost much in our battle with the Dourhands.'
'I am glad you have survived this massacre.'
'Come, my pupil. Show me that you are ready for the war beyond these doors to ease my troubled heart!'
'Let us see how well you have learned!'
While visiting Edhelion with your master, an Elf named Talagan, the mountain refuge suddenly finds itself under attack from a violent, bloodthirsty dwarf named Skorgrím, king of the Dourhand family.
'Tell me, though: what news do you bring?'
'But we must not give up. Skorgrím must not be allowed to reach the relics!'
'You must get into the courtyard and bolster our defences there!'
'You should continue west, up the stairs.'
'Come, this way. I must defend the library against Skorgrím.'
'Eventually you will make your way to the courtyard's west gate.'
'Be wary of invaders along the way. They are everywhere!'
'Come, follow me! This place isn't safe any longer.'
'Your master, Talagan, wishes to speak with you before you set off to defend Edhelion.'
'Dorongúr, come! Talagan alone defends the library! He sent me to save [placeholder].'
'Hurry then, come with me! Talagan will need our help!'
'Go, Talagan. Take [placeholder] out of here. I must hide the relics before Skorgrím appears to claim them.'
Talk to Talagan Silvertongue outside of the library
Aid in the defence of the courtyard
'[placeholder] was last to see them. #-1:[placeholder]{She[f]|He} would be able to tell you.'

'Those Dourhands were everywhere! I honestly did not think we would survive, but Dorongúr had the sense to bar the doors to the courtyard. With the courtyard as our final redoubt, we were able to push the Dourhand dwarves back.

'I know though that if the courtyard falls, all of Edhelion may go with it. You must help in the defence of the courtyard. Go up the stairs to the west and travel along until you come to the back gate. Once there, Dorongúr should let you in.

'Be careful; a few of the invaders may still be about.'

'Good, young [placeholder], you are whole. Do not worry about me, I will be fine. It is but a minor wound. Once I bind it, I will make my way into the courtyard to help as I may. But do not wait on me: go to the courtyard now and help in its defence until Elrond arrives.

'This gate is barred, for fear the other gates will not hold, but the back entrance may be open. Go up the stairs to the west and travel along until you come to the back gate. Once there, Dorongúr will let you in.

'Be careful, though: there may still be a few stragglers left behind.'
Elrond Halfelven beckons for you to come and speak with him, for a war rages outside.\n\nSpeak with Elrond. <rgb=#00ff00>Right-click on characters to interact</rgb>.

'Those in the courtyard will need your help until Elrond returns. The main gates are barred, so you should travel to the west and go up the stairs. From there, travel along to the back entrance. Hopefully, someone will let you in.\n\n'Be careful, though...there may still be a few stragglers left behind that you may have to deal with.'
Elrond Halfelven beckons for you to come and speak with him, for a war rages outside.\n\nSpeak with Elrond. <rgb=#00ff00>Right-click on characters to interact</rgb>.

The satchel is on the floor near Elrond.

You should look inside the satchel for any weapons you can use to better protect yourself, for a war rages outside.

<rgb=#00FF00>(Right-click on glowing items to interact with them. To collect the contents of the satchel, click the button marked 'Loot All,' and the items will appear in your inventory.)</rgb>
'Talagan, I have found your student! Quickly -- say what you wish to say. [placeholder] is not safe here for long.'

Now that you have acquired some new weapons, you should equip them.

<rgb=#00FF00>ACCESSING YOUR INVENTORY: Press 'i' to open your inventory to see the weapon or left-click on the bag icons on the bottom of your screen.</rgb>

<rgb=#00FF00>EQUIPPING YOUR WEAPON: Right-click on the weapon in your inventory to equip it. This will replace the flimsy weapon you currently have equipped.</rgb>

<rgb=#FF0000>ADVICE: You should equip your best weapon before attempting to engage in combat.</rgb>

Your master Talagan wishes to see that you are prepared to face the battle beyond the doors of the library.

To start fighting Talagan, <rgb=#00ff00>right mouse-click</rgb> on him to initiate your standard attack. To use your <rgb=#ffff00>Abilities</rgb> either <rgb=#00ff00>left mouse-click</rgb> on the <rgb=#ffff00>Action Buttons</rgb> on your <rgb=#ffff00>Quick Slots Bar</rgb> (found at the bottom of the screen) or by pressing the associated <rgb=#ffff00>Hotkey</rgb>.

Defeat Talagan to advance.
A great thunder has shaken the library. Speak with Elrond to find out what you should do.
Talagan Silvertongue has told you that he would like you to make your way to the courtyard of Edhelion and help defend it from further attack.
